actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow the deduction of certain expenditures for food and lodging primarily for medical care.

summary.text: Allows the tax deduction, under the Internal Revenue Code, of expenditures for food and lodging primarily for medical care for up to 21 days and not to exceed the amount allowed to employees of the United States for reimbursement for travel expenses.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow the deduction of certain expenditures for food and lodging primarily for medical care.
